remarks: An apparent strengthening of ~ ax-dc (but derived from it) which shows that there is a denumerable sequence ` g ` for any function that maps elements of a set ` A ` to nonempty subsets of ` A ` such that ` g ( x + 1 ) e. F ( g ( x ) ) ` for all ` x e. _om ` .  The finitistic version of this can be proven by induction, but the infinite version requires this new axiom.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jan-2013.)
statement:
axdc2.1 $e |- A e. _V $.
axdc2 $p |- ( ( A =/= (/) /\ F : A --> ( ~P A \ { (/) } ) ) -> E. g ( g : _om --> A /\ A. k e. _om ( g ` suc k ) e. ( F ` ( g ` k ) ) ) ) $.
$d A g k $.
$d A k $.
$d F g k $.
$d F k $.
$d g k $.
